channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk’s gaming scandal deepens as X owner attempts to silence streamer Asmongold for blowing the whistle
item.description: Elon Musk boasted he's among the world's top ranked video game players. Now he's getting called out by other gamers for supposedly lying about his rec...

item.title: Ozempic, Wegovy among 15 drugs selected for next round of Medicare price negotiations
item.description: The price negotiations almost assures billions of dollars in savings for taxpayers.

item.title: The people who ghost you may think they’re being nice—and be more willing to help than you assume
item.description: Ghosters are more likely to offer help than ghostees expect, a study shows—with implications for careers and networking.

item.title: What We Know About the Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Agreement
item.description: Israel’s security cabinet approved the deal on Friday. It will now go before the full cabinet, which is expected to green-light it.

item.title: Trump Team Rebuffs Talks on Mass Deportations, Latin American Countries Say
item.description: Mexican officials and other leaders in the region have not been able to meet with the incoming administration about the president-elect’s migration an...

item.title: David Lynch Showed Us Who We Are in Dark Masterpieces Like ‘Eraserhead’
item.description: The director himself came off as almost performatively normal. Masterpieces like “Eraserhead” and “Mulholland Drive” said otherwise.

item.title: After 15 Months of War, Gazans Dream of Returning Home
item.description: They daydreamed about the people they would hug as soon as the truce took hold, the graves they would visit and the homes they would rebuild.

item.title: Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok if it’s not sold by its Chinese parent company
item.description: Ruling: The risk to national security posed by its ties to China overcomes concerns about limiting speech by the app or its 170 million users in the U...

item.title: Live Updates: Israeli Security Cabinet Approves Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said the deal, which is expected to be greenlit by the full cabinet later today, could go into effect as ea...

item.title: ‘Severance’ Is Back. Here’s a Season 1 Recap to Jog Your Memory.
item.description: It’s been almost three years since the Season 1 finale. This refresher should help jog your memory.

item.title: The Terrifying Ride of Copter 17
item.description: A former Army pilot. An aging helicopter. Furious winds. The race to put out the Eaton fire tested Los Angeles County’s night-flying firefighters like...

item.title: Trump Team Rebuffs Talks on Mass Deportations, Latin American Countries Say
item.description: Mexican officials and other leaders in the region have not been able to meet with the incoming administration about the president-elect’s migration an...

item.title: What to Know About the Potential TikTok Ban
item.description: The Supreme Court on Friday upheld a law that could result in the app going offline as soon as Sunday.

item.title: Mastercard slapped with $26 million discrimination lawsuit after being accused of underpaying thousands of employees
item.description: The company was accused of underpaying 7,500 female, Black, and Hispanic US employees compared to their male and white colleagues.

item.title: Chrystia Freeland, Justin Trudeau’s ‘Minister of Everything,’ Enters Race to Replace Him
item.description: Chrystia Freeland, the former deputy prime minister, sought to distance herself from Mr. Trudeau in a public letter criticizing him for “costly politi...
